required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Surgical Site Infections on Patient Reported Cosmetic Outcomes in Dermatologic Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Surgical Site Infections on Patient Reported Cosmetic Outcomes in Dermatologic Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: This study involves surveying two matched groups of patients that underwent dermatologic surgery at our department. One group had a documented surgical site infection and the other didn't. All patients will be asked to complete a questionnaire in which they assess the physical appearance of their scars and its psychosocial impact. Results will be compared between the groups.

detailed_description.textblock: 65 patients with a documented surgical site infection will be compared to 65 patients with normal wound healing in terms of patient reported outcome regarding scar physical appearance and psychosocial impact using SCAR-Q questionnaire.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparing mean values of SCAR-Q scores in both groups
primary_outcome.description: Scar-Q (http://qportfolio.org/scar-q/) is a patient reported outcome instrument in which scars will be assessed in terms of scar appearance and psychosocial impact. Scores will range from 0 (worst) to 100 (best). Scores will be compared between the two groups using either parametric or non-parametric tests depending on the distribution of the results.

secondary_outcome.measure: Association between patient characteristics and SCAR-Q scores
secondary_outcome.description: Score values (0-100) will be correlated to the following patient characteristics (gender, age, type of surgical procedure, anatomic location, and diagnosis of excised lesion)

study_pop.textblock: All included patients had a surgical procedure performed at our department. One group had documented surgical site infections and the other didn't.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient above 18 years of age that underwent a dermatosurgical procedure at our department between march 2017 and march 2020.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients assessed as not suitable for telephone survey due to hearing disabilities or cognitive impairment

facility.name: Department of dermatology, Sk√•ne university hospital
